answers.answer: Pro bono legal help, free legal and humanitarian assistance, assistance with obtaining refugee status, resolving civil or administrative legal issues, and complimentary legal counseling are available for Ukrainian refugees.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-help and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Ukrainian refugees can find pro bono legal help through the UA.SUPPORT campaign, by contacting ACTEDO, accessing the UNHCR's list of lawyers via QR code, or by contacting CNRR's dedicated hotline.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-help and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The National Association of the Romanian Bars (through UA.SUPPORT), ACTEDO, UNHCR, and CNRR offer legal support to Ukrainian refugees.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-help and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The National Association of the Romanian Bars provides free legal and humanitarian assistance for Ukrainian refugees through a campaign that matches refugees seeking help with lawyers willing to offer support.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-help and read the section under 'Lawyers for refugees A campaign by the National Association of the Romanian Bars'.

answers.answer: The UA.SUPPORT campaign facilitates legal assistance by matching Ukrainian refugees seeking legal help with lawyers who are willing to offer support.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-help and read the section under 'UA.SUPPORT'.

answers.answer: ACTEDO addresses legal issues such as obtaining refugee status and resolving various civil or administrative legal issues that refugees encounter during their stay in Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-help and read the section under 'ACTEDO'.

answers.answer: Refugees can access the list of lawyers compiled by UNHCR by scanning the provided QR code.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-help and read the section under 'Phone list of lawyers from UNHCR who help refugees'.

answers.answer: CNRR offers complimentary legal counseling to refugees and asylum seekers, providing necessary legal guidance and support for any questions or legal assistance required, confidentially.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-help and read the section under 'Free Legal Counseling for Refugees and Asylum Seekers'.

answers.answer: CNRR's legal counseling service can be contacted via their dedicated hotline at +40730073170, and is also accessible through WhatsApp, Telegram, and Viber.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-help and read the section under 'Free Legal Counseling for Refugees and Asylum Seekers'.

answers.answer: The CNRR legal counseling hotline operates from Monday to Friday, 8:00 AM to 10:00 PM.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-help and read the section under 'Free Legal Counseling for Refugees and Asylum Seekers'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian refugees can receive legal assistance in Romania and other countries.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-help and read the section under 'Pro bono legal help for Ukrainian refugees in Romania and other countries'.

answers.answer: Lawyers willing to offer support to Ukrainian refugees can volunteer through these initiatives, specifically via the UA.SUPPORT campaign.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-help and read the section under 'UA.SUPPORT'.

answers.answer: Lawyers willing to offer support can be matched with Ukrainian refugees seeking legal help through the UA.SUPPORT campaign.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-help and read the section under 'UA.SUPPORT'.

answers.answer: Refugees in Romania may face administrative challenges such as obtaining refugee status or other various civil or administrative legal issues that require legal help.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-help and read the section under 'ACTEDO'.
